text: If its just a lost connection flumine should retain the info automatically, however if its a manual stop or lengthily cut out (i.e. where it can't immediately reconnect) then you would need to make a REST API call to get the info (list current orders probably from what you're saying is what you need).

elements.text: If its just a lost connection flumine should retain the info automatically, however if its a manual stop or lengthily cut out (i.e. where it can't immediately reconnect) then you would need to make a REST API call to get the info (list current orders probably from what you're saying is what you need).

text: pseudo code is roughly, call list_current_orders, create the trade (for which the orders will sit on), from the CurrentOrders, create the flumine orders and append to the trade, add the orders into the market.blotter, add the trade into whereever you store it for later access (most people use the context dicts)

text:
Maybe a bit dodgy, but simple. At restart I poll current_orders and do this:
framework.handler_queue.put(flumine.events.events.CurrentOrdersEvent([current_orders]))
